title: List 2-distance coloring of planar graphs
abstract: The $$2$$ -distance coloring of a graph $$G$$ is to color the vertices of $$G$$ so that every two vertices at distance at most $$2$$ from each other get different colors. Let $$\chi _{2}^{l}(G)$$ be the list 2-distance chromatic number of $$G$$ . In this paper, we show that (1) a planar graph $$G$$ with $$\Delta (G)\ge 12$$ which contains no $$3,5$$ -cycles and intersecting 4-cycles has $$\chi _{2}^{l}(G)\le \Delta +6$$ ; (2) a planar graph $$G$$ with $$\Delta (G)\le 5$$ and $$g(G)\ge 5$$ has $$\chi _{2}^{l}(G)\le 13$$ .
